_README.description: Implied volatility snapshot for VIX options (volatility of volatility)
_README.important_note: VIX options measure volatility OF volatility - different from equity options

vix_background.what_is_vix: CBOE Volatility Index - measures S&P 500 30-day expected volatility
vix_background.vix_range: Typically 10-30, can spike to 50+ during crises
vix_background.vix_options: Options on VIX itself - used to hedge or speculate on volatility changes

fields_explanation.current_price: Current VIX level (not a price, but volatility index value)
fields_explanation.average_iv: Average of ATM VIX call and put implied volatility
fields_explanation.average_iv_formatted: IV as percentage - NOTE: VIX IV is much higher than equity IV
fields_explanation.iv_level: Classification specific to VIX (different scale than equities)

interpretation.vix_iv_meaning: High VIX option IV = Market expects large swings in volatility itself
interpretation.typical_range: VIX option IV typically 80-150% (much higher than equity options)
interpretation.low_vix_iv: IV < 100% - Market expects stable volatility environment
interpretation.high_vix_iv: IV > 150% - Extreme uncertainty about future volatility
interpretation.vix_term_structure: Compare near-term vs longer-term VIX option IV for term structure insights

use_cases.hedge_volatility: VIX options used to hedge against volatility spikes
use_cases.volatility_trading: Traders speculate on volatility changes using VIX options
use_cases.crisis_indicator: Extreme VIX option IV can signal market stress

^VIX.name: CBOE Volatility Index
^VIX.note: VIX options measure volatility of volatility - unique characteristics
